intro: Echium modestum var. brevicalyx, commonly known as the short-calyx fleabane, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender, branching stems covered in fine, hairy foliage. The plant produces clusters of small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its flowers are characterized by their short, broad calyx, which gives the variety its specific name. Echium modestum var. brevicalyx is often found in dry, sunny habitats such as rocky soils and open grasslands.
